description: [English Version] Updated on 2024.05.22, optimized important metric display. Rebuilt with Grafana 10 new style, added health score concept, and added some charts of overall resource consumption information. Contains overall resource display and resource details charts: CPU, memory, disk, IO, network and other monitoring metrics. https://github.com/starsliao/TenSunS

panels.title: üè°Resource Overview: Current JOB[$origin_prometheus: $job] Current Host[$show_name] Instance: $instance

panels.description:
Partition usage, disk read, disk write, download bandwidth, upload bandwidth. If there are multiple network cards or partitions, the values from the network card or partition with the highest utilization are collected.

Connections: CurrEstab - Number of TCP connections currently in either ESTABLISHED or CLOSE-WAIT state.

Health score is a new metric calculated based on CPU, memory, and IO. A score below 90 indicates that the system's resource usage needs attention. This is a metric under testing, and parameters may need to be optimized based on actual situations.
panels.title: Server Resource Overview Table [Total Hosts: $total]

panels.description:
- P99: The value at the 99th percentile when the dataset is sorted in ascending order. (i.e., the value at the 99% position when sorted in ascending order)
- This table requires adding recording rules to Prometheus (refer to the dashboard download page)
- Data will be displayed one hour after adding the recording rules.
- Time range [7d:1h] indicates viewing hourly data points for the past 7 days.
panels.title: Last 7 Days P99 Resource Usage
Overall Total Load and Overall Average CPU Usage
Overall Total Memory and Overall Average Memory Usage
Overall Total Disk and Overall Average Disk Usage

panels.description:
In this dashboard: Total disk space, used space, available space, and usage percentage are consistent with the Size, Used, Avail, and Use% columns of the df command, and the Use% value is rounded to one decimal place for greater accuracy.

Note: The formula for Use% in df is: (size - free) * 100 / (avail + (size - free)), the result is that value if it's an integer division, or that value + 1 if it's not, with the unit being %.
Reference df command source code:
panels.title: [$show_name]: Partition Available Space(EXT.*/XFS/NFS)

matcher.options: Processes Blocked Waiting for IO Completion

targets.legendFormat: Processes Blocked Waiting for IO Completion

panels.description:
Read time seconds: Seconds spent on read operations for each disk partition

Write time seconds: Seconds spent on write operations for each disk partition

IO time seconds: Seconds spent on input/output operations for each disk partition

IO time weighted seconds: Weighted seconds spent on input/output operations for each disk partition
panels.title: Time Per IO Read/Write (Reference: Less than 100ms)

panels.description:
Reads completed: Number of read operations completed per second for each disk partition

Writes completed: Number of write operations completed per second for each disk partition

IO now: Number of input/output requests currently being processed per second for each disk partition
panels.title: Disk Read/Write Rate (IOPS)

panels.description:
Read bytes: Bits read per second for each disk partition
Written bytes: Bits written per second for each disk partition
panels.title: Disk Read/Write Capacity Per Second

panels.description:
Time spent on I/O within each second of wall-clock time.

node_disk_io_time_seconds_total:
Seconds spent by disk on input/output operations. This is a cumulative value. (Milliseconds Spent Doing I/Os)

irate(node_disk_io_time_seconds_total[1m]):
Calculates the per-second rate: (last value - previous value)/timestamp difference, i.e., the proportion of time spent on I/O operations within 1 second.

matcher.options: Idle - Waiting for something to happen

panels.title: I/O Operation Time Percentage Within 1 Second (I/O Util)

panels.description:
Sockets_used - Total number of all protocol sockets in use

CurrEstab - Number of TCP connections currently in ESTABLISHED or CLOSE-WAIT state

TCP_alloc - Number of allocated TCP sockets (established, with sk_buff allocated)

TCP_tw - Number of TCP connections waiting to close

UDP_inuse - Number of UDP sockets in use

RetransSegs - Number of TCP segments retransmitted

OutSegs - Number of TCP segments sent

InSegs - Number of TCP segments received

properties.value: Total of all protocol sockets in use

panels.title: Network Socket Connection Information

title: Node Exporter Dashboard 20240520 Common JOB Group Version
